meanings.definition: To expel or force out again.
meanings.sent1: The teacher had to reexpel the disruptive student from the classroom.
meanings.sent2: After causing trouble for the third time, the principal decided to reexpel him from school.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel managed to reexpel the nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The storm reexpelled the fallen leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent5: The vacuum cleaner reexpelled the dust into the air, creating a cloud of particles.

meanings.definition: To eject or remove from a place or situation once more.
meanings.sent1: The security guard had to reexpel the troublemaker from the concert venue.
meanings.sent2: The bouncer warned the unruly patron that he would reexpel him if he caused any more disturbances.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to reexpel the rabbit from the hat, but it seemed to have disappeared.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind reexpelled the fallen leaves back onto the path.
meanings.sent5: The chef accidentally reexpelled the ingredients from the mixing bowl while trying to stir the batter.
